What is a non-restrictive clause?
Adds extra info with commas (e.g., My brother, who lives in Perth, is visiting)
What is the difference between less and fewer?
less for uncountable, fewer countable
What is hedging in academic writing?
using cautious language (e.g., this suggests vs this proves)
What is parallelism?
Using consistent structure (eg. she likes hiking, swimming and cycling)
Is irregardless a word?
no, use regardless
What is the difference between who and whom?
Who is used as subject, who called? Whom object, to whom did you call?
Why should you avoid cliches?
lack of originality weakens writing or argument
What is a dangling participle?
absence of clear subject (running late, the bus was missed -> running late, I missed the bus
Is it could of or could have?
could've sounds like could of
Is it correct to say me and my mate went to the beach?
no, my mate and I
Difference between affect and effect?
affect, verb, to influence / effect, noun, result
When do you capitalise a word, list all three occasions
start of a sentence, proper noun, titles
When do you use a dash?
for emphasis or set off extra information - like this!
When should you use a colon?
Before a list / explanation / or quote
What is a contraction?
Merged version of two words, like It's from It is
What is passive voice?
When the subject receives the action (eg. The die is cast)
Is it correct to say the team are playing well?
No, the team is a collective noun, so should use singular verb instead
What is a fragment?
An incomplete sentence missing a subject or verb (eg. running down the street)
Define a complex sentence
One independent clause + one dependant clause (eg. after it rained, the plants grew)
Define a compound sentence
Two independent clauses joined by a conjunction (eg. I ran, but I missed the bus)
Identify the interjection: Wow! That surf was huge!
Wow!
What is an article?
A, an, the
Correct the mistake: The reason is because...
The reason is that | The reason being
Correct the mistake: She ran faster than I.
She ran faster than I did / me
Is it correct to say "Stupid you have become"?
Yes, it is called anastrophe, inverted word order for empasis
What is a periodic sentence, give example
builds to a main clause at the end (eg, Despite failure, difficulty, abuse, we won.)
What is the difference between e.g. and i.e.?
e.g. = for example, i.e. = that is
What is wrong with: A well known artist
well-known, compound adjectives before noun needs to be hyphenated
Why would italics be used for a word in dialogue?
To show emphasis
What is the difference between imply and infer?
imply = to suggest; infer = to deduce
